author: abehazbunjr
title: Tokenized Stake Tracking
description: Dado que la estafa no ofrece ningún mecanismo de seguimiento de las conversiones, las OPC no tienen visibilidad sobre el ROI de la publicidad o los mensajes efectivos.

f6_assessments.q0:
Draft proposal of only 62 words requesting $8k.
The proposer posted many proposals of which 5 are in the same state of unwithdrawn draft.
So my assessment of these proposals will be very similar. The proposer should have withdrawn these proposal to save time to the voters and to the community advisors.
f6_assessments.q1:
Draft proposal. A link to a GitHub account is given but almost nothing else. We also know that the proposer is a Plutus pioneer.
Like in his 5 other draft proposals, the proposer completed the questionnaire telling the required information was provided while it is not the case.
f6_assessments.q2:
62 words cannot provide enough information for any Catalyst proposal.
It is written in the proposal that a plan was to be provided by the end of the week on 2021-11-28 but ultimately was not.

f6_assessments.q0:
I think I am competent to assess this proposal as I have been active in project Catalyst since fund 4 and I have experience analyzing business requirements from 7 years of delivering software as a QA engineer.
From the problem statement, I understand that it's not good SPO's don't have a way to measure how effective any advertising they do is, but I don't understand what the proposers mean when they imply staking itself should offer this. Furthermore, can't SPO's actually just start an ad campaign for their pool and then measure the number of new wallets delegating to them in the months following the campaign compared to the months prior to it?
The solution is too technical in my opinion to properly explain to a regular voter what exactly it is and how it would work. Unfortunately, this information cannot be found anywhere else in the proposal either. Staking is done via wallets right now and I fail to understand how an on-page script would fit in here. Airdrops are also mentioned but no detail is given at all about what the proposers meant here. Would the participating SPO award ADA to a wallet delegating to them?
Due to this proposal attempting to increase the attractiveness of delegating to SPO's, it probably fits in this challenge, but the unanswered questions above and the lack of any type of KPI or concrete goal force me to strongly disagree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
One of the proposers mentions that he is a Plutus student and the notes on the provided github do reflect this, but there does not seem to be much other activity there, especially in the fast few months. Aside from this, two years of Cardano experience are mentioned - this is too vague in my opinion. Try to detail what exactly you have done in the ecosystem in the future. Lastly, 14 years of experience of web analytics and managing large technical projects are mentioned, but no references are provided to verify this. It's a good idea to try to add at least a Linkedin page to back you up. The other proposer seems to be a stake pool, but there are no details about them, or about the operator here. Is it the proposer themselves? It would be good to have this information.
I strongly disagree that this proposal can be implemented successfully, due to the lack of information on the team who would work on this, no details on how the budget would be used, no risk analysis and no plan outlining the technical approach and the usage of resources concretely. As the proposers mentioned, the full plan was due at the end of November, but it does not seem to have made it unfortunately.
f6_assessments.q2: There are no KPI's or a roadmap, due to the proposal being unfinished, so I strongly disagree that this proposal is auditable.

f6_assessments.q0:
I think this idea is very good and would go a long way to help SPOs have some analytics tools for increasing their delegations instead of being left to fend for themselves.

However, this proposal is clearly lacking a roadmap and it is very difficult to say that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge, as currently written.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the person behind this project, GitHub work and technical proficiency I actually believe this proposal would have a high likelihood of success, but the proposal lacks an actual roadmap which really hurts the idea that this proposal would be successful. Therefore I can only give this proposal a max of 3 stars until at bare minium a roadmap with some reasonable milestones at 3 6 and 12 months out.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal describes giving SPOs tool to track and measure their metrics such as conversion ration, impressions, CTR. This should be included in a detailed roadmap with these metrics being implemented as the milestones, in additional, some KPIs to track the progress of the proposal would go a long way in helping to determine the relative success of this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a thought plus an idea, not a full proposal. The proposer says "Detailed plan to be submitted by the end of this week, 11/28/21" but until now we don't see any detailed plan in this proposal
f6_assessments.q1: Tthere is a lack of information about the project itself, such as detailed roadmap, goals and timeframe, it's not possible to evaluate if a team is required, and this is not mentioned in the proposal. This information should be included.The budget is not broken down and it is not possible also to evaluate if it's appropriate or not. There is a lack of general information regarding the feasibility of this proposal, since it's not possible to evaluate based only on the idea. To improve its feasibility, the proposer should include: a roadmap, timeframe, details about the proposer and a budget breakdown, at least.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal lacks information to properly evaluate its auditability. In order to improve the auditability, the proposer should include a roadmap, milestones, the time horizon of development, key dates, metrics and KPIs. Also, the budget should be detailed to add the possibility of checking the proposal expenditures.

f6_assessments.q0: proposal lacks detail. Its a difficult to understand how this proposal will provide a better way to monitor impact/conversion than other monitoring methods.
f6_assessments.q1: While the proposer appears to have relevant experience, they clearly haven't put much thought or time into the proposal. This makes me doubt their ability and motivation to produce a product that will standout from others and benefit SPOs.
f6_assessments.q2: No roadmap or metrics for success are provided.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal focuses on providing users register stake with an on-page script that confirms stake, triggers ad tracking, reveals dynamic site content & activates airdrops. Since this proposal is incomplete (no roadmap, KPIs/metrics, and budget breakdown,...), the solution is still very abstract, unclear impact on the Cardano ecosystem as a whole. Based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's impact, and would give it a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer's profile is briefly described as a full-time Plutus student with two years of Cardano experience and 14 years of web analytics and managing large technical projects, followed by an external link [https://github.com/seamossonline] for verification. However, a detailed plan is not provided, therefore, there is no proof of feasibility. Based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's feasibility, and would give it a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no roadmap, KPIs/metrics, and budget breakdown,... as a result, auditability/transparency can't be guaranteed. Therefore, I strongly disagree with this proposal's auditability, and would give it a score of 1.

f6_assessments.q0:
- There are already wallets showing the ROI of Ada delegation.
- Please more clearly define the "on-page script that ... activates airdrops." Would that be a script run by a SPO or an independent site that displays said metrics?
- Register user stake on is redundant to users. Unless you are talking about creating a new wallet.
f6_assessments.q1:
- Proposers are apparently running a successful stake pool.
- github page has incomplete information.
f6_assessments.q2:
- Timeline is missing.
- It would be great if you could include a timeline of what would be completed by when, and the metrics to measure by the timeline. 
- I imagine the success of this project would look like an optional script for SPO to download that displays the delegators' status with metrics similar to live view.

solution: Los usuarios registran la participación con un script en la página que confirma la participación, activa el seguimiento de los anuncios, revela el contenido dinámico del sitio y activa los lanzamientos aéreos.
experience: Soy un estudiante de Plutus a tiempo completo con dos años de experiencia en Cardano y 14 años de analítica web y gestión de grandes proyectos técnicos.
